intro: Costus secundus, commonly known as the zigzag costus, is a tropical plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its striking, zigzagging stems and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, emerging in clusters at the base of the plant. Costus secundus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
